metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7424 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The getaddrinfo function in glibc before 2.15, when compiled with libidn and the AI_IDN flag is used, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid free) and possibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, as demonstrated by an internationalized domain name to ping6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced by https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=34a9094f49241ebb72084c536cf468fd51ebe3ec lucid doesn't look vulnerable

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.5').
